description.narrative: The Bilateral Programme for Burkina Faso 2021 – 2025 has a total budget of DKK 1,050 million, of which DKK 143 million is set aside as an “adaptability reserve” to be allocated to activities over the course of the programme. The programme takes place in the context of a severe security crisis giving rise to uncertainty and lack of predictability in many respects as well as climatic developments gradually worsening the general economic prospects and peoples’ livelihoods. This overall context, whose combined implications are likely to worsen rather than ease during the programme, obviously makes an adaptive approach particularly important in the case of Burkina Faso. The “adaptability reserve” is to be spent within the three strategic objectives of the Bilateral Programme and on transversal interventions supporting the operationalisation of the development, humanitarian and peace nexus. Another DKK 18 million will assure the establishment and running of the Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability and Learning (MEAL) architecture in line with the Doing Development Differently approach applied in the programme.
